speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE I. Court of Macbeth's castle.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter BANQUO, and FLEANCE bearing a torch before him

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: How goes the night, boy?

speaker: FLEANCE
text_entry: The moon is down; I have not heard the clock.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: And she goes down at twelve.

speaker: FLEANCE
text_entry: I take't, 'tis later, sir.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Hold, take my sword. There's husbandry in heaven;

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Their candles are all out. Take thee that too.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: A heavy summons lies like lead upon me,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: And yet I would not sleep: merciful powers,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Restrain in me the cursed thoughts that nature

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Gives way to in repose!

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Enter MACBETH, and a Servant with a torch

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Give me my sword.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Who's there?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A friend.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: What, sir, not yet at rest? The king's a-bed:

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: He hath been in unusual pleasure, and

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Sent forth great largess to your offices.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: This diamond he greets your wife withal,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: By the name of most kind hostess; and shut up

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: In measureless content.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Being unprepared,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Our will became the servant to defect;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which else should free have wrought.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: All's well.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: I dreamt last night of the three weird sisters:

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: To you they have show'd some truth.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I think not of them:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Yet, when we can entreat an hour to serve,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We would spend it in some words upon that business,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If you would grant the time.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: At your kind'st leisure.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If you shall cleave to my consent, when 'tis,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: It shall make honour for you.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: So I lose none

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: In seeking to augment it, but still keep

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: My bosom franchised and allegiance clear,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: I shall be counsell'd.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Good repose the while!

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Thanks, sir: the like to you!

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Exeunt BANQUO and FLEANCE

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Go bid thy mistress, when my drink is ready,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: She strike upon the bell. Get thee to bed.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Is this a dagger which I see before me,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The handle toward my hand? Come, let me clutch thee.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I have thee not, and yet I see thee still.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Art thou not, fatal vision, sensible

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To feeling as to sight? or art thou but

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A dagger of the mind, a false creation,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Proceeding from the heat-oppressed brain?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I see thee yet, in form as palpable

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As this which now I draw.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou marshall'st me the way that I was going;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And such an instrument I was to use.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Mine eyes are made the fools o' the other senses,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Or else worth all the rest; I see thee still,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And on thy blade and dudgeon gouts of blood,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which was not so before. There's no such thing:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: It is the bloody business which informs

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thus to mine eyes. Now o'er the one halfworld

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Nature seems dead, and wicked dreams abuse

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The curtain'd sleep; witchcraft celebrates

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Pale Hecate's offerings, and wither'd murder,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Alarum'd by his sentinel, the wolf,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whose howl's his watch, thus with his stealthy pace.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With Tarquin's ravishing strides, towards his design

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Moves like a ghost. Thou sure and firm-set earth,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hear not my steps, which way they walk, for fear

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thy very stones prate of my whereabout,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And take the present horror from the time,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which now suits with it. Whiles I threat, he lives:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Words to the heat of deeds too cold breath gives.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A bell rings

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I go, and it is done; the bell invites me.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hear it not, Duncan; for it is a knell

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That summons thee to heaven or to hell.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit
